As I have stated in Snowstorm's forums, I'm getting ready to tidy up a
whole bunch of my gladiator stuff from multiple programs so I can
consolidate them into one program that will come pretty close to being
a good scenario editor (literally, a few steps away from being a good
scenario editor - the big feature it will be missing is a way to
preview the map with the objects on it ahead of time and imo a good
scenario editor has to have a preview function.)

This is where I'm getting stumped: do you guys want click-on buttons
to do stuff or pull-down menus to do stuff?  Your choice for your GUI.

Here's what it will do right off the bat:

1)copy, decode, and encode grid tile information
2)copoy, decode, and encode scenario file information (all the objects
in a map)
3)run the map smoother function over an entire map :)
4)create html maps :)

Here's the stuff that I plan on working on:

1)polishing up my map by exception work
2)figuring out what options to give the user for search-and-replace
functionality for objects in a map
3)creating thumbnail images using a ported-out version of the radar
function
4)*somehow, figure out appropriate conversions so I can have a
recaliberation function to make characters in scenarios pretty
comparable to the existing player(s) team.

* * * *

Incidently, I've run into a snafu printing out my html maps.  It seems
as though I can only print one page width wide and not get the entire
map printed out.
